hanzi-su-wiki:
長

Значения

Длинный

🔑168

Мнемоника

  • Пучок длинных волос. Три верхних горизонтали — волосы. Нижняя горизонталь — стягивающая их лента. Правая вертикаль — пучок. Справа внизу — заколка.

  • Изображение человека с длинными волосами.

Описание

Пиктограмма изображает волосы, которые такие длинные, что их нужно завязывать. Позже в иероглиф была также добавлена шпилька. Этот иероглиф обозначает старшего брата, старшего в группе, но также означает «расти», «развиваться». Волосы — это признак возраста, в то время как борода — признак мудрости.

Сочетание ключа с иероглифом «мотор» дает «капитан», наиболее опытный человек среди экипажа. Соединив ключ с иероглифом «пожилой», получим «настоятель», наиболее образованный и добродетельный монах буддийского монастыря. Сочетание с иероглифом «сын» дает «старший сын», «первенец», тот, у кого должны быть самые длинные волосы. Совместно с иероглифом «близкий, соседний» ключ выражает значение «прогресс».

机长/機長 капитан
长老/長老 настоятель
长子/長子 первенец
长进/長進 прогресс

Варианты

长, 镸

(Simplified: 长)
Pictographic: An old man with long hair and a cane
Antonyms: 幼 短
purpleculture_examples:
長期 [ cháng qī ]: long term; long time; long range (of a forecast)
長江 [ cháng jiāng ]: Yangtze River, or Chang Jiang
長遠 [ cháng yuǎn ]: long-term; long-range
長沙 [ cháng shā ]: Changsha prefecture-level city and capital of Hunan province in south central China
長城 [ cháng chéng ]: the Great Wall
heisig_chinese_memo: The Geisha with long hair uses an ornate lacquered hairpin to bundle it all up.
heisig_story: In line with the story of the preceding frame, the hair that needs the hairpin is long.
koohiiStory1: The Geisha with long hair uses an ornate lacquered hairpin to bundle it all up.
koohiiStory2: The top of this one reminds me of the staple primitive. So here´s my story: The girl´s hair was so long that she had to use staples instead of hairpins. It worked, but stapling her hair to her head was kinda painful.
jp_example_words:
長(おさ): chief, head
生長(せいちょう): growth, increment
長官(ちょうかん): chief, (government) secretary
長大(ちょうだい): very long, great length
長編(ちょうへん): long (e.g. novel film)
長々(ながなが): long, drawn-out, very long
年長(ねんちょう): seniority
長閑(のどか): tranquil, calm, quiet
延長(えんちょう): extension, elongation, prolongation, lengthening
議長(ぎちょう): chairman
身長(しんちょう): height (of body), stature
成長(せいちょう): growth, grow to adulthood
長期(ちょうき): long time period
長所(ちょうしょ): strong point, merit, advantage
長女(ちょうじょ): eldest daughter
長短(ちょうたん): length, long and short, advantages and disadvantages, pluses and minuses, strong and weak points, merits and demerits
長男(ちょうなん): eldest son
長方形(ちょうほうけい): rectangle, oblong
特長(とくちょう): forte, merit
長引く(ながびく): be prolonged, drag on
校長(こうちょう): principal
社長(しゃちょう): president
長い(ながい): long
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic:
The long radical and the long kanji are the same!
This kanji also means leader, because the longer a person is, the better a leader they'll be. Or maybe it was... the longer they've been somewhere? Whatever, longness = leaderness, you know?
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: As long as you know the radical long, you know the kanji long as well.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You see a very long person. It's Mrs. Chou (ちょう), who has made herself long, like her street. "I made myself long so I can watch more of the street, my domain. I'm the leader of these streets. Watch yourself not-long person," says Mrs. Chou.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Long isn't an idea that's easy to imagine in any specific sense, but you can try some other things too, as long as it gets associated with Mrs. Chou. For the most part, when you see a kanji with the radical 長 the reading will be ちょう.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: An archaeologist comes across an animal leg and an animal horn.  Strangely the horn is as long as the leg, so he wonders what kind of animal it could've possibly been!
origin_of_ch_char_book: (長, 长, zhang, chang, older; long) An old man with his long hair is handling something skillfully. The old man is good at many things as a result of all his experience. The eastern people considered respect for the older person as one of the most important virtues, so they even didn’t cut their hair because the hair is the remnant of the old parents. (老, lao, old) describes an old person bending his back wearing an elaborate head-dress, and a child or a man bowing to him . Although this character is used as the old person now, the original meaning was a person of no ordinary status; an older bureaucrat.
humanum_full_description_en:
A golden inscription looks like an old man with long hair leaning on a cane (Ye Yusen, Liu Zhao, Liu Xinglong, Shen Pei). The original meaning is elder, old, and extended from long hair to length.

The initial meanings of the characters " long " and " old " are similar, because the elderly are synonymous with the elderly. Some glyphs omit the crutch shape. The crutch shape or corruption becomes a " dagger " shape. Zhongshan Wangding’s " Long " is added next to "立".

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the name of the country or place, as well as the name of the person and the name of the southern style (see Xu Zhongshu). Inscriptions on gold indicate long-lasting, and the wall of history: "Civil and Wu Chang Lai (Strong)", which represents the long-term foundation created by King Wen and King Zhou Wu. Zhongshan Wangding: "Long to be the lord of the people" means to be the monarch for a long time. It also means being older, Zhongshan Wangding: "Things are young girls (such as) long".

"Said Wen": "Long, long time. From Wu from the dagger. Wu, the meaning of lofty. Long time changes. The sound of death. The person who is dead is also dead. All the long belongings are from the long. The ancient text is long. , Also the ancient prose."
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jinwen is like a long-haired old man with a cane. The original meaning is the elderly, the elderly.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文象一個長髮老人拄着拐杖之形(葉玉森、劉釗、劉興隆、沈培)，本義是長者、年長，又從長髮引申為長短之長。

　　「長」字與「老」字的構形初義相近，因為長者實與老人同義。部分字形省去拐杖之形。拐杖形或訛變為「匕」形。中山王鼎的「長」字加從「立」旁。

　　甲骨文用作方國名或地名，又用作人名、南方風名等(參徐中舒)。金文表示長久，史牆盤：「文武長剌(烈)」，表示周文王、周武王所開創之長久的基業。中山王鼎：「長為人主」，表示長久以來作為君主。又表示年長，中山王鼎：「事少女(如)長」。

　　《說文》：「長，久遠也。从兀从匕。兀者，高遠意也。久則變化。亾聲。□者，倒亾也。凡長之屬皆从長。仧，古文長。𠑿，亦古文長。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文象一個拄着拐杖的長髮老人，本義是長者、老人。

heisig_comment: * The primitive of this kanji has two more shapes in addition to that of the kanji itself. Above its relative primitive, it is abbreviated form will mean hair. Further abbreviated, it will mean the long, mangy mane of an animal.

The eastern people considered respect for the older person as one of the most important virtues, so they even didn’t cut their hair because the hair is the remnant of the old parents. (Simplified: 长)
Pictographic: An old man with long hair and a cane
Antonyms: 幼 短
  • Chinese Definition:
  • Chinese Definition:
  • ⿱ Above to below
    ①兩端的距離：長度。
    ②長度大，與“短”相對，指空間，亦指時間：長短。長空。長短句(詞的別名)。長夜(ａ．漫長的黑夜；b．喻黑暗的日子)。長風破浪(喻志趣遠大)。長歌代哭(以歌代哭)。
    ③優點，專精的技能：特長。專長。各有所長。
    ④對某事做得特別好：他長於寫作。
    ⑤少幼消短。
    長期 [ cháng qī ]: long term; long time; long range (of a forecast)
    長江 [ cháng jiāng ]: Yangtze River, or Chang Jiang
    長遠 [ cháng yuǎn ]: long-term; long-range
    長沙 [ cháng shā ]: Changsha prefecture-level city and capital of Hunan province in south central China
    長城 [ cháng chéng ]: the Great Wall
    ①生長；成長。［合］長俊(長進；進步)；長成(長大成人)；長立(長大自立)；長牙；長毛；長肉；長胖。
    ②撫育；使……成長。［合］長養(撫育培養)；長育(養育)。
    ③滋長，助長，增長。［合］長託(滋補身體)；長美(增長美德)；長傲(滋長傲氣)；長益(促進，增益)；長消(消長，盛衰)；長知識；此風不可長。
    ④崇尚。
    ⑤做長官；爲首領。
    ⑥升高(多指水位或物價)。後作“漲”。［合］長成(小孩長得高)；長價；水長船高。

    甲金文象一個長髮老人拄着拐杖之形(葉玉森、劉釗、劉興隆、沈培)，本義是長者、年長，又從長髮引申為長短之長。 「 長 」字與「 老 」字的構形初義相近，因為長者實與老人同義。部分字形省去拐杖之形。拐杖形或訛變為「 匕 」形。中山王鼎的「 長 」字加從「 立 」旁。 甲骨文用作方國名或地名，又用作人名、南方風名等(參徐中舒)。金文表示長久，史牆盤：「文武長剌(烈)」，表示周文王、周武王所開創之長久的基業。中山王鼎：「長為人主」，表示長久以來作為君主。又表示年長，中山王鼎：「事少女(如)長」。 《說文》：「長，久遠也。从兀从匕。兀者，高遠意也。久則變化。亾聲。□者，倒亾也。凡長之屬皆从長。仧，古文長。𠑿，亦古文長。」

The original meaning is elder, old, and extended from long hair to length. The initial meanings of the characters " long" and " old" are similar, because the elderly are synonymous with the elderly. Some glyphs omit the crutch shape. The crutch shape or corruption becomes a " dagger" shape. Zhongshan Wangding’s " Long" is added next to " 立". The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the name of the country or place, as well as the name of the person and the name of the southern style (see Xu Zhongshu). Inscriptions on gold indicate long-lasting, and the wall of history: "Civil and Wu Chang Lai (Strong)", which represents the long-term foundation created by King Wen and King Zhou Wu. Zhongshan Wangding: "Long to be the lord of the people" means to be the monarch for a long time. It also means being older, Zhongshan Wangding: "Things are young girls (such as) long". "Said Wen": "Long, long time. From Wu from the dagger. Wu, the meaning of lofty. Long time changes. The sound of death. The person who is dead is also dead. All the long belongings are from the long. The ancient text is long. , Also the ancient prose."

    “仧1”的今字。亦作“兏1”。“长1”的繁体字。“镸1”的今字。
    (1)指在空间的两端之间距离大。㈠同“短”相对。《诗·齐风·猗嗟》：“猗嗟昌兮，頎而長兮。”汉张衡《西京赋》：“流長則難竭，柢深則難朽。”宋姜夔《续书谱·用墨》：“筆欲鋒長勁而圓。長則含墨，可以運動，勁則有力，圓則妍美。”亦指长度。《论语·乡党》：“必有寢衣，長一身有半。”《史记·天官书》：“彗星，長二丈，類彗。”汉荀悦《汉纪·成帝纪三》：“二月癸未夜，星隕如雨，長二丈。”《西游记》第三回：“那時此寳有二丈多長，斗來粗細。”㈡高。《墨子·公输》：“荆有長松文梓，楩柟豫章，宋無長木，此猶錦繡之與短褐也。”《荀子·非相》：“仲尼長，子弓短。”明高启《入郭过南湖望报恩浮屠》诗：“漁人爲指江城近，一塔船頭看漸長。”亦指高度。《庄子·盗跖》：“﹝跖﹞身長八尺二寸，面目有光，脣如激丹。”汉司马相如《上林赋》：“欃檀木蘭，豫章女貞，長千仞，大連抱。”南朝宋谢惠连《祭古冢文》：“刻木爲人，長三尺。”《西游记》第五回：“吃了幾個桃子，變做二寸長的個人兒，在那大樹梢頭濃

    長字的康熙字典解释

    【戌集上】【長字部】　長； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页1328第07
    〔古文〕镸???????【唐韻】【集韻】直良切【正韻】仲良切，?音場。【增韻】短之對也。【孟子】今交九尺四寸以長。【前漢·田橫傳】尺有所短，寸有所長。　又久也。【詩·商頌】濬哲維商，長發其祥。【箋】長，猶久也。【老子·道德經】天地所以能長且久者，以其不自生，故能長生。　又遠也。【詩·魯頌】順彼長道，屈此羣醜。【箋】長，遠也。【古詩】道路阻且長。　又常也。【陶潛·歸去來辭】門雖設而長關。【李商隱詩】風雲長爲護儲胥。　又大也。【世說新語補】願乗長風，破萬里浪。　又善也。【晉書·樂廣傳】論人必先稱其所長。【唐書·韓琬傳】文藝優長。　又【博雅】長，挾也。　又【吳語】孤敢不順從君命，長弟許諾。【註】長弟，猶云先後也。　又星名。【博雅】太白謂之長庚。【詩·小雅】東有啓明，西有長庚。【傳】日旦出，謂明星爲啓明。日旣入，謂明星爲長庚。　又宮名。【班固·西都賦】北彌明光而亙長樂。【謝朓·怨情詩】掖庭聘絕國，長門失歡宴。【註】長門，漢?皇后所居。　又地名。【玉海】長

    Chinese dictionary definition of words
    [①]［cháng］
    ["Guangyun" Zhiliang cut, Pingyang, Cheng. ]
    The present character of "仧1". Also known as "兏1". Traditional characters of "长1". The present character of "镸1".
    (1) Refers to the large distance between the two ends of the space. (I) Contrast with "short". "Poetry·Qifeng·Yibo": "Yibo is prosperous and prosperous, but prosperous and long." Han Zhang Heng, "Xijing Fu": "It is hard to be exhausted if it has a long history, and it is hard to perish if it is deep." Song Jiangkui "Continued Book" "Use ink": "The pen wants to be sharp and round. Longer contains ink and can be moved. Strong is powerful, and round is beautiful." It also refers to length. "The Analects of Confucius Xiangdang": "There must be a bedclothes, half of a long body." "Historical Records of Heavenly Official Book": "Comet, two feet long, like a comet." Han Xunyue "Han Ji · Cheng Di Ji San": " On the night of Guiwei in February, the stars fell like rain and were two feet long.” The third chapter of "Journey to the West": "At that time, this treasure was more than two feet long, the thickness of the battle." (ii) High. "Mozi·Gongyu": "Jing Youchang Song Wenzi, Li Nan Yuzhang, Song Wuchangmu, this is beautiful and short brown." "Xunzi · Feixiang": "Zhongni is long, Zi bow is short. "Ming Gaoqi's poem "Entry Guo Guo, Cross Nanhu Lake and Repay the Graceful Buddha": "The fisherman means that the river is near, and the bow of a tower is getting longer." It also means height. "Zhuangzi · Pirate": "﹝跖﹞ is eight feet and two inches long, with a radiant face, and lips like a pill." Han Sima Xiangru's "Shanglin Fu": "Zan Mulan, Yuzhang Privet, Qianren long , Dalian hug." Southern Song Xie Huilian "Sacrifice to the Ancient Tomb": "Carved wood for people, three feet long." The fifth episode of "Journey to the West": "After eating a few peaches, I became a two-inch long individual. Thick at the top of the big tree

    Name meaning
    Nothing.
    cháng, zhǎng, zhàng
    вм. 长

    長

    Значения

    Длинный

    🔑168

    Мнемоника

    • Пучок длинных волос. Три верхних горизонтали — волосы. Нижняя горизонталь — стягивающая их лента. Правая вертикаль — пучок. Справа внизу — заколка.

    • Изображение человека с длинными волосами.

    Описание

    Пиктограмма изображает волосы, которые такие длинные, что их нужно завязывать. Позже в иероглиф была также добавлена шпилька. Этот иероглиф обозначает старшего брата, старшего в группе, но также означает «расти», «развиваться». Волосы — это признак возраста, в то время как борода — признак мудрости.

    Сочетание ключа с иероглифом «мотор» дает «капитан», наиболее опытный человек среди экипажа. Соединив ключ с иероглифом «пожилой», получим «настоятель», наиболее образованный и добродетельный монах буддийского монастыря. Сочетание с иероглифом «сын» дает «старший сын», «первенец», тот, у кого должны быть самые длинные волосы. Совместно с иероглифом «близкий, соседний» ключ выражает значение «прогресс».

    机长/機長 капитан
    长老/長老 настоятель
    长子/長子 первенец
    长进/長進 прогресс

    Варианты

    长, 镸

    Radicals: 長  (long)
    Meaning Mnemonic
    The long radical and the long kanji are the same!
    This kanji also means leader, because the longer a person is, the better a leader they'll be. Or maybe it was... the longer they've been somewhere? Whatever, longness = leaderness, you know?
    As long as you know the radical long, you know the kanji long as well.
    Reading Mnemonic
    You see a very long person. It's Mrs. Chou (ちょう), who has made herself long, like her street. "I made myself long so I can watch more of the street, my domain. I'm the leader of these streets. Watch yourself not-long person," says Mrs. Chou.
    Long isn't an idea that's easy to imagine in any specific sense, but you can try some other things too, as long as it gets associated with Mrs. Chou. For the most part, when you see a kanji with the radical 長 the reading will be ちょう.
